title: Center of mass of two falling blocks

content.question: A block of mass <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and a block of mass <math alttext="3 M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are connected by a string, as shown above. The blocks are held with the string horizontally and are released from rest at the same time from a height <math alttext="H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> above the ground. How does the acceleration of the center of mass of the system compare to the acceleration of the object of mass <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The acceleration of the center of mass is <math alttext="4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> times the acceleration of the object of mass <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The acceleration of the center of mass is one fourth the acceleration of the object of mass <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The acceleration of the center of mass is the same as the acceleration of the object of mass <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The acceleration of the center of mass is initially <math alttext="4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> times smaller than the acceleration of the object of mass <math alttext="3 M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, but the accelerations are the same after a long time.

content.answer: The acceleration of the center of mass is the same as the acceleration of the object of mass <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.
